SEARCH
Package ie.atu.sw

Class Runner

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.Runner
public class Runner extends Object
Runner class for managing the application lifecycle. Displays a menu for user navigation. Allows users to specify input/output files and configuration options. Executes the program

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      Main method to run the application. Displays the menu in a loop until the application stops.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs O(n) n is the number of iterations in the loop.

    • stopRunning

      public void stopRunning()
      Stops the application by setting the running flag to false. O(1) constant time

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the application is still running Used to colntrol main loop
      Returns:
      true if running, false otherwise O(1) constant time

    • specifyEmbeddingFile

      public void specifyEmbeddingFile(Scanner s)
      Prompts the user to specify the embeddings file path.
      Parameters:
      s - Scanner for user input O(n) depends on number of lines in embeddings file.

    • specifyInputFile

      public void specifyInputFile(Scanner s)
      Prompts the user to specify the input text file path.
      Parameters:
      s - Scanner for user input O(1) constant time

    • specifyOutputFile

      public void specifyOutputFile(Scanner s)
      Prompts the user to specify the output file path.
      Parameters:
      s - Scanner for user input O(1) constant time - no reading in of data

    • executeAndAnalyse

      public void executeAndAnalyse(Scanner s)
      Executes the processing and analysis of files. Validates the input/output file paths and embeddings file. Loads the list of words from Google 1000 Simplifies the text file and saves the result
      Parameters:
      s - Scanner for user input O(n) for each

    • configureOptions

      public void configureOptions(Scanner s)
      Configure display options method to allow user to choose background invalid input: '&' font colours
      Parameters:
      s - Scanner for user input O(1) constant time - no reading in of data
